resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/105657</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>105657</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086177</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Freeze.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Frost.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Gel.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Freeze.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Freeze.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Πάγωμα.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Helada.</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Frenchman Louis Daguerre's improvements in photography reached America in the 1840s. Personal portraits were soon the craze, and daguerreotype' studios sprang up in every city, while traveling daguerreotypists served the countryside. This picture presents the controlled environment of the early studios. It took so long to properly expose a photographic plate that the subject needed a head brace to hold a pose.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Franzose Louis Daguerres Verbesserungen in Fotographie 
erreichtem Amerika in den persönlichen Portraits 1840s. waren bald 
der Verrücktheit, und daguerreotype ' Studios entstanden in jede 
Stadt, während reisende daguerreotypists die Landschaft dienten. 
Diese Abbildung stellt die kontrollierte Umgebung der frühen 
Studios dar. Sie nahm, also sehnen Sie sich, um eine 
fotographische Platte richtig herauszustellen, der das Thema eine 
Hauptklammer benötigte, eine Haltung anzuhalten.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les améliorations de Louis Daguerre de Français 
Amérique atteinte par photographie dans les verticales 1840s. 
personnelles étaient bientôt la manie, et studios de daguerreotype 
les 'ont pris naissance dans chaque ville, alors que les 
daguerreotypists de déplacement servaient la campagne. Cette 
image présente l'environnement commandé des studios tôt. Elle
a pris ainsi désirez ardemment pour exposer correctement un plat 
photographique que le sujet a eu besoin d'un croisillon principal pour
juger une pose.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">As melhorias de Louis Daguerre do frenchman em América 
alcançada fotografia nos retratos 1840s. pessoais eram logo a mania, 
e os estúdios do daguerreotype ' saltaram acima em cada cidade, 
quando os daguerreotypists viajando serviram ao campo. Este 
retrato apresenta o ambiente controlado dos estúdios adiantados. 
Fêz exame assim que long para expo corretamente uma placa 
fotográfica que o assunto necessite uma cinta principal manter um 
pose.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">I miglioramenti di Louis Daguerre del francese in America 
raggiunta fotographia nei ritratti personali 1840s. erano presto la
mania e gli studi del daguerreotype 'si sono generati in ogni città, 
mentre i daguerreotypists mobili hanno servito la campagna. 
Questa immagine presenta l'ambiente controllato degli studi in 
anticipo. Ha preso in modo da desideri per esporre correttamente
una piastra fotografica che l'oggetto ha avuto bisogno di un sostegno 
capo di giudicare una posa.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι βελτιώσεις Γάλλου Louis Daguerre's στη 
φωτογραφία έφθασαν στην Αμερική στο 1840s. που τα προσωπικά 
πορτρέτα ήταν σύντομα η τρέλα, και daguerreotype "τα στούντιο 
αναπήδησαν επάνω σε κάθε πόλη, ενώ τα διακινούμενα 
daguerreotypists εξυπηρέτησαν την επαρχία. Αυτή η εικόνα 
παρουσιάζει το ελεγχόμενο περιβάλλον των πρόωρων στούντιο. 
Πήρε τόσο πολύ για να εκθέσει κατάλληλα ένα φωτογραφικό 
πιάτο ότι το θέμα χρειάστηκε ένα επικεφαλής στήριγμα για να 
κρατήσει ότι θέστε.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Las mejoras de Louis Daguerre del francés en América 
alcanzada fotografía en los retratos personales 1840s. eran pronto la
manía, y estudios del daguerreotype los ' se originaron en cada 
ciudad, mientras que los daguerreotypists que viajaban sirvieron el 
campo. Este cuadro presenta el ambiente controlado de los 
estudios tempranos. Tomó así que desee para exponer 
correctamente una placa fotográfica que el tema necesitó una 
paréntesis principal llevar a cabo una actitud.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>

END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086177</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">No License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>105657</entry>

    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/libraries/freeze</uri>

    </item>
  </manifestation>
